Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which the American Rescue Plan is a "partisan wish list" by stating that 91% of the plan falls into this category.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the majority of the plan is a "partisan wish list."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Democratic special interests were the sole reason for the passage of the American Rescue Plan, without considering other factors or motivations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the fact that Republicans offered an alternative rescue bill that included similar elements to the Democratic plan, suggesting that there are alternative explanations for the contents of the plan.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that a significant portion of the plan, approximately 9%, is allocated to COVID-19 health spending.
Understate: The claim understates the importance and allocation of funds towards COVID-19 health spending, dismissing it as only 9% of the plan.
Falters at times: The claim falters in accurately representing the overall composition and purpose of the American Rescue Plan.
